cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today ranked 8th for the heaviest total rainfall during a storm, dropping 13.04mm over the storm duration of 7.9 hours with a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour.  Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 27.64mm over 15.9 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today ranked highest for the heaviest rainfall, with a peak intensity of 27.0mm per hour sustained for 2.0 hours, resulting in a total accumulation of 7.99mm.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024, characterized by a peak rain intensity of 6.4mm per hour and a total rainfall of 24.56mm.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: Currently experiencing a significant rainy period, ranked 5th longest since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 9 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (205°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.31 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1572 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 18.6m higher than yesterday, 469.2m lower than the past week, 1572.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 1085.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and winds will be practically absent. Moderate rainfall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
